stratfile.name: Blueprint to 2016
stratfile.keyProblems:
There were several factors which affect our clients and therefore impacts the organization. Many of our clients face various personal and socio-economic challenges including time, money, and nutrition.
However, there are also many specific challenges faced by segments of our clients. For example, Youth are not effectively represented or engaged in their local communities and furthermore they are not sufficiently educated about municipal government. Families have a tough time finding quality programs and services which are affordable due to the reduction in public programs and services as well as the continuous shift in social policies. Decision-makers, both elected and appointed, are also affected by financial factors and time constraints as well as a lack of engagement within the general population. They therefore - generally speaking - focus their efforts on "tax payers" and those eligible to vote without seeking input from those who the decision could potentially affect the most, youth.
stratfile.addressProblems:
Novus United is committed to creating programs, services, and building a representative organization for our clients which will directly impact them in a positive manner. We wish to drive the organization to create actionable and relevant solutions to any foreseeable obstacles faced by our customers.
Our team is a reflection of the diverse population found in Canada, consisting of youth, decision-makers, parents, educators, and organizations. We have determined that, when communicating with our youth, it is important for us to adapt a communication style that will both represent a sense of professionalism while still displaying a degree of relatable language formation. Additionally, when promoting our programs and services, as well as initiating a level of participation from youth, it is important to clearly outline the benefits that will be drawn from participating in our programs and services from both the youth as well as the decision-makersâ€™ perspective. It is fundamental that strong relationships are created with people who have influence, resources, and can ultimately empower Canada's youth; in exchange, we must provide youth, to decision-makers, who are active, enthusiastic, involved, and will prove to be a valuable resource for the decision-maker(s). Networking opportunities will tie the youth and decision-maker categories as well as providing youth with skill-building opportunities; will essentially entice and strengthen the likelihood of participation among youth and decision-makers.
Furthermore, providing opportunities for our customers and creating communication that our audience can relate to and appreciate, Novus United must also focus on creating a strong branding strategy to ensure we are creating communication that is consistent with the organization as a whole. As it stands, our individuals programs: CYCTO and CAMP AC are becoming well-known brands and would be in the best interest of Novus United to remain in the background with regard to naming and awareness. As a team, we are comfortable and think it is best to continue to nurture our program and, thus, program names on an individual basis and focus on strengthening those brands. The Novus United name and organization is to simply serve as the umbrella organization for these programs and services.
stratfile.customersDescription: Our target audience ranges from children to seniors and everyone in between. These age groups vary depending upon the organization, level of government, and even country. Therefore, for the purposes of the delivery of our programs and services we define children as between the ages of 6 and 12, "teens" as between the ages of 13 and 17, adults between the ages of 18 and 64, seniors as age 65+, and "youth" as between the ages of 14 and 24.
stratfile.competitorsDescription:
Canada is filled with talented and ambitious youth, and people. We boast a diverse and vibrant population, a reputation we wear with pride around the world. That being said, it is only natural for several organizations to recognize the genuine and true talent found in Canada, many of whom, like Novus United, are committed to helping communities grow and to nurture both children and youth. In Toronto, for example, both the Toronto Youth Cabinet and the TDSB SuperCouncil are two large and well-known establishments who are representing youth. United Way as well as Toronto Parks and Recreation are also large and well-known establishments in the delivery of programs and services to all age groups.
What makes Novus United and our programs and services unique is that, with regard to youth councils, we are the first in Canada to initiate the concept of democratically electing youth representatives in a manner that models current government institutions while adapting in such a way that allows us to be innovative in our delivery. We have been actively and successfully creating partnerships with several decision-makers, institutions, youth, and influencers to build this initiative and as we continue to grow we are committed to sourcing organizations and initiatives to partner with so that we can further both of our causes.
Our primary source of revenue, Camp All Connected, has been a successful endeavour and is the only camp to provide nutritious snacks and lunch as part of our registration fee while maintaining our affordability. Currently we are focusing our efforts in Toronto, Ontario which has a very competitive market when it comes to the delivery of programs and services to children and youth - given its dense population - and so we have aspirations to expand to other municipalities which have a lack of programs and services; especially considering a majority of municipal governments don't offer anywhere near the amount of programs and services that the City of Toronto does through their parks and recreation department.
Constantly striving towards our goals to create relevant programming and services to youth, our evaluation of potential programs and competitors is an ongoing process.
stratfile.businessModelDescription:
To continue to create a sustainable organization and to develop communities, our team will look into initiating programs and revenue-generating projects upon evaluation of our resources and capacities.
Currently our revenue generation stems primarily from our Camp All Connected program, memberships and donations, and grants.
stratfile.expansionOptionsDescription: For the next 5 years, our sights are set on creating a positive impact among the Greater Toronto Area and the Golden Horseshoe. We place a focus on developing a strong pilot in Toronto and then expanding to other municipalities in Ontario and eventually across the country. As part of this mission, it would be beneficial for us to reach out to similar organizations in other countries and begin to create relationships with them.
stratfile.ultimateAspiration:
Novus United is committed to assisting with and providing Canada's communities with sustainable opportunities which will enhance their life and encourage taking pride in their community. This enhancement will be seen in their willingness and desire to actively participate on a social, culture, and political level in the community.
Our aspiration is to re-develop Canada's communities. We are looking to re-define what a community means and to bring people closer together on a local level in municipalities of all sizes.
stratfile.mediumTermStrategicGoal: By 2016 we will be legally registered with an overall budget of $2M, offer quality programming for children and their families within the Greater Toronto Area, and bridge the gap between youth and decision-makers through democratically elected youth councils.
